sen.j: 平坦線の跡地は清滝道（京都府道29号宇多野嵐山山田線、京都府道137号清滝鳥居本線）として道路に改修された。
sen.e: The railway became a freeway called "Kiyotaki-do Road", made up of Utano Arashiyama Yamada Route on Kyoto Prefectural Road 29, and Kiyotaki Toriimoto Route on Kyoto Prefectural Road 137.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The railway was transformed into a road called the Kiyotaki-do Road (consisting of the Utano Arashiyama Yamada Route on the Kyoto Prefectural Road 29, and the Kiyotaki Toriimoto Route on the Kyoto Prefectural Road 137).

The railway was transformed into a road called the Kiyotaki-do Road (consisting of the Utano Arashiyama Yamada Route on the Kyoto Prefectural Road 29, and the Kiyotaki Toriimoto Route on the Kyoto Prefectural Road 137).

sen.j: 現在は京都バス嵐山営業所の路線が運行されている。
sen.e: Currently the Arashiyama branch of Kyoto Bus company operates on these routes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Currently, the Arashiyama Branch Office of the Kyoto Bus Company provides transportation along these routes.
Currently, the Arashiyama Branch Office of the Kyoto Bus Company provides transportation along these routes.

sen.j: また平坦線の遺構として単線トンネルの清滝トンネルが残存しており、片側交互通行で道路に転用されている。
sen.e: Also Kiyotaki Tunnel remains as a relic of the railway line, and is now used as a freeway with one way alternate traffic.
The Kiyotaki Tunnel, which was the single-track tunnel of the flat line, still remains and is now re-used as an one-way alternating traffic road.
The Kiyotaki Tunnel, which was the single-track tunnel of the flat line, still remains and is now re-used as an one-way alternating traffic road.

sen.j: 鋼索線の遺構も清滝川駅跡地や線路跡、愛宕駅の駅舎建物などが残存している。
sen.e: Relics of the funicular line include the site of Kiyotakigawa Station, disused railway tracks and Atago Station building.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Remnants of the funicular line also exist, including the remaining site of Kiyotakigawa Station, the disused railway tracks, and the Atago Station building.
Remnants of the funicular line also exist, including the remaining site of Kiyotakigawa Station, the disused railway tracks, and the Atago Station building.

sen.j: しかし、愛宕駅舎は崩壊しかけており、また6つあるトンネルのうち2つは内部が崩壊していて、非常に危険な状態になっている。
sen.e: However the Atago Station building is in a state of near collapse, with two out of the six tunnels inside damaged and in a dangerous condition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Atago Station building, however, is in a state of near collapse, with two out of the six tunnels inside heavily damaged and in a dangerous condition.
The Atago Station building, however, is in a state of near collapse, with two out of the six tunnels inside heavily damaged and in a dangerous condition.

sen.j: 橋梁などその他のコンクリート製構造物も風化が進んでおり崩壊の危険がある。
sen.e: Other concrete constructions, such as bridges, are also dilapidated and in danger of collapse.
Bridges and other crete structures are seeing the effects of weathering and are in danger of collapse.
Bridges and other concrete structures are seeing the effects of weathering and are in danger of collapse.

sen.j: 中には片側が完全に崩壊している（レールのセメントは現存）ものもある。
sen.e: Indeed, some have already collapsed completely on one side (just the cement structure on a rail still exists).
Some have already collapsed completely on one side, leaving only the cement portion of the rail.
Some have already collapsed completely on one side, leaving only the cement portion of the rail.

sen.j: 鋼索線の廃線跡を愛宕神社 (京都市)への上級者向け登山道の一つとして通行する者がいる。
sen.e: Some people use the abandoned funicular line site as a mountain trail to Atago Shrine (Kyoto City) regarding it as a trail for experienced hikers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Experienced hikers presently use the path left behind by the abandoned funicular line as a mountain trail to Atago Shrine (Kyoto City).
Experienced hikers presently use the path left behind by the abandoned funicular line as a mountain trail to Atago Shrine (Kyoto City).

sen.j: しかし、上記の理由により危険であるため経験者の同行がない場合は立ち入るべきではない。
sen.e: However because it is in such a dangerous condition you must not enter the site without somebody experienced (indeed it is forbidden to enter part of the site because of the danger of collapse and other hazards).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because of the dangerous conditions, entering the site without being accompanied by an experienced hiker is not recommended.
However, because of the dangerous conditions, entering the site without being accompanied by an experienced hiker is not recommended.

sen.j: （一部区間は崩壊などの理由で立ち入り禁止となっている）。

sen.e: (Sections which are completely off-limits do exist.)

sen.j: また、携帯電話も通じないため、万一の際には救助が手遅れになることも覚悟する必要がある。
sen.e: Additionally, because the area is out of cell phone coverage you should be aware that in case of an emergency rescue may be delayed.
Additionally, because the area is outside of the range of cell phone coverage, hikers should not rely upon rescue efforts in the case of an emergency.
